job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros:
-Summer Friday’s are good but only for certain departments and managers! 
-Students, faculty and staff are great.
cons:
-every person is overworked and under compensated. 
- they rely heavily on the student workforce to pick up the remaining work instead of hiring more staff. This is part of the “work study” program where they pay students minimum wage and work them nonstop to keep the school afloat! 
- leadership is all about leadership. If you are not at the higher levels, you will not be heard or seen. It is a bunch of former musicians running things and they seem to be making a lot of stuff up as they go! 
-was verbally reprimanded in front of my entire team. 
-constantly expected to work when on vacation 
-experience is not a factor when hiring people, it’s solely about money. They will hire recent alumni and pay them a basic amount regardless of experience or knowledge. 
-there are no metrics for gauging the success of a team- the mentality is get it done or else. 
-the HR does not exist. It’s one person who seems to tell the president the staff’s information and is not there to help the staff. 
-gossip runs rampant at SFCM. It is the main way many of the staff find out about large projects we have committed to completing.
-there are ways to advance your career- you do the job you have and that is it! you can just take on more work but not be compensated.
